abstract: New York City Comptroller Scott M Stringer says his office will audit city's Board of Elections to determine whether 125,000 Democratic voters in Brooklyn were improperly removed from voter rolls; inquiry comes in response to complaints over irregularities and voter difficulties during one of most consequential presidential primaries in years.

headline.print_headline: Voting Issues Spur Stringer  to Audit Elections Agency
headline.main: Voting Problems Prompt Comptroller to Vow Audit of New York City’s Elections Board

snippet: The city comptroller, Scott M. Stringer, said he wanted to determine if tens of thousands of Democratic voters were improperly barred from the polls.
lead_paragraph: The city comptroller, Scott M. Stringer, said he wanted to determine if tens of thousands of Democratic voters were improperly barred from the polls.
